cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles east of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the east coast of Florida before lifting toward the Georgia–South Carolina coastline and the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: somewhere along the southeast Florida coast (Boca Raton–Volusia/Flagler County line) late 2 Aug, with a secondary landfall/close coastal pass near the South Carolina coast early 4 Aug

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; hurricane watch Hallandale Beach FL to south of Boca Raton FL; tropical-storm watch Volusia/Flagler Co. line FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Flagler County line FL; Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained 34-kt (gale) winds; any gusts most likely late Mon–early Tue and generally below 45 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible but currently expected to stay below 3 ft along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain expected as the storm brushes the coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Monday
